hypothesis_content.title: Meme Coin (DOGE/PEPE) Extreme 1H Fade in Neutral Markets
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, when a high-volume meme coin (DOGE or PEPE) experiences a 1-hour price pump of >15% on volume >150% of its 20-hour average, a short entry at the close of that 1H candle will be profitable before a retracement of 50% of that hourly move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Meme coins are driven by sentiment and momentum. In a neutral overall market, lacking a strong bullish tailwind, such extreme hourly moves are often unsustainable and driven by coordinated pumps or FOMO that quickly exhausts. High volume confirms participation, making the subsequent fade more likely.
entry_conditions: 1H volume for the pumping candle > 150% of the 20-hour average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the 1H pump candle's range (from open to high)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves 5% above the entry (pump) candle's high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Win rate for the short strategy is < 50% OR the average winner is smaller than the average loser over >30 identified signals in historical NEUTRAL periods.
